intro: Thysselinum schiwerekii, commonly known as the Schiwerek's thistle, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its spiny leaves and yellow composite flowers, which are typical of the daisy family. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
